relation: Great for these types of students
I have never experienced any danger on this campus
For only about $550 per semester, this is a great school to get GE classes and prerequisites out of the way before transferring.
There is a cafeteria with a somewhat limited selection of decent but average food.
I did not stay in the dorms
Many of the instructors also teach classes at the nearby University, so they have impressive credentials. Overall this school offers a good education for a community college.

The classes are small and involved, with about 30 students per 1 teacher, which makes a good learning environment. The administration offers relatively poor service. The prices are reasonable, which is good on a budget.

textAfterTable: Comments Tips for prospective students Check teachers on ratemyprofessor.com. Although I said that there are good teachers, there are still a couple that do not completely have everything together yet and make it rather difficult at times. Bang for the buck Fairly inexpensive and offers a B.O.G. waiver which waves all tuition. Also, a program called E.O.P.S. provides book vouchers for those who qualify. Am enjoying being here Beautiful campus. Am learning a lot Many of the professors are very helpful and knowledgeable.
